main event: A civilian observer spotted a round, red object with a white top over Forrestville, Ohio on December 21, 1955.
interesting points: The object was observed for 45 minutes and moved at a very slow speed at a very high altitude.
The observer used 12x52 binoculars to visually observe the object.
The object was reported to the military through various commands, including the Commander of the 552nd ACURON Brookfield Air Force Station in Ohio.
The report indicates the object was likely a commercial aircraft, but there was insufficient data to determine its identity conclusively.
The report was classified as 'unknown' due to the lack of information on the object's disappearance and motion.
sighted object: round, red object with a white top
